comments.commentBody: Posts 1-3 are nothing more than the rantings of a hateful bigot. Relegating homosexuality to a "behavior," rather than a status/sexual orientation is merely a device to rationalize unadulterated hatred and prejudice. The idea that "heterosexuals make love, but homosexuals only have sex" is one of the many lies perpetuated by this garden variety homophobe. Disgusting.

The republicans would go running like chickens with their heads off if we returned to the income tax rates we had from 1933 until 1961, which included a 91% income tax on the top 400 or so insanely rich families. (it was actually 94% during parts of world war II.)

Having a rate structure that makes those who use the most of our society actually pay their fair share is what gives us the best economy ever. That's what we need to return to, and to do so, we have to get those republicans out of the picture.

Having a rate structure that makes those who use the most of our society actually pay their fair share is what gives us the best economy ever. That's what we need to return to, and to do so, we have to get those republicans out of the picture.
We need a comprehensive program that includes reductions in spending and increased revenues, at least, for a few years. We need vision about what government means and does. We need a sense of limits.
We need a comprehensive program that includes reductions in spending and increased revenues, at least, for a few years. We need vision about what government means and does. We need a sense of limits.

Just gonna have to vote for Al Sharpton next time ... remind me again why all of a sudden the deficit is lumped in with the bubonic plague. Just a couple of years ago it was a non-issue. Yeah, it's an issue, but what's with the scorched-earth policy targeting the little guys?

Nothing seems to be beneath this President who has betrayed the people that elected him, time and time again on issues of finance reform, jobs, civil liberties, and social programs. Nothing has made so strong an argument for a third party alternative as his presidency.

Nothing seems to be beneath this President who has betrayed the people that elected him, time and time again on issues of finance reform, jobs, civil liberties, and social programs. Nothing has made so strong an argument for a third party alternative as his presidency.

Mr. President:

Why not give the Republicans everything, kill the middle class, and leave the working people and the poor with no hope, no options, no education, and no health care. After all, that plan worked so well for the rich aristocrats in France, right up to 1789.

Large portions of this report are gibberish. I add that Durban is a Democrat in name only.
Large portions of this report are gibberish. I add that Durban is a Democrat in name only.

President Obama assume way too much from Congressional Democrats and, quite frankly, his supporters.

If he is to suggest cuts to Medicare, Medicaid and Social Security, he'd better come up with SUBSTANTIAL and ACTUAL revenues concessions (this Boehner offer of "commitment to revamp the tax code" cannot be taken seriously) to offset the cuts. Moreover, it would wise for his own political survival to make absolutely sure that said cuts will not and cannot affect beneficiaries.

The president is walking a tightrope here. He should not assume that because the Republican field of presidential candidates is underwhelming that a second term is guaranteed. Doesn't he remember 2010?

Well, I see two major problems for the US. Wasteful in front of goal, and pace in the back. Mitts is really a right back (who looked rusty and slow in the Mexico pre-Cup friendly), and LePeilbet is actually a better defender than Cox, but anyone she faces will have more speed and more skill. Sundhage must give her help. And she must sit Boxx, who'll be roadkill in this match. Actually, make that 3 problems: lack of creativity. Cheney IMO is our best playmaker, but she's better in the middle -- so why is she stuck out on the wing? Especially the left wing, where she's supposed to screen LePeilbet in defense (but instead drifts inside)?

Everyone talks about Marta and Cristiane, but Rosana's got my Goal of the Tournament so far (for its improbable degree of difficulty against excellent defending), Fabiana has quite the afterburner, and Erika just showed us what she can do. Obviously we can't focus on just one player, and in the chaotic style they play it isn't always clear where the attack will come from. OTOH they start off slow and confused in that disorganized mess of a 343 and need a half to sort things out; I'm sure we'll get our chances, especially early. If for once we can stop being wasteful we're definitely in it. Going into the half with the lead would be nice. OT3H, despite that horrible shape they pretty handily kept a clean sheet against some sides that I think would give us quite the fight.

Thanks, NYT editor, for telling me I'm off the mark.

I couldn't have known that from the actual article, which is the sad part of this. Seeing yet another writer willfully disregard the actual skill set in favor of "heart" and "optimism" (he's a better man than I if he can determine someone's "playing with optimism") strongly suggested he didn't really understand the actual details of good soccer.

My bad.

NYT editor: No biggie. Thanks for reading.

"Can someone please change the subject to Casey Anthony or Lindsay Lohan or something...?"
-Rupert M.

I told you not to have a facebook account. in the old days it was illegal to listen to private conversations. now people put their private conversations on facebook and twitter. Nuts!

the future will be about a battle to wind back this wholesale handing over of privacy.

I am annoyed that the NYT has chosen to highlight comments that blame Murdoch's behavior on : A) his underlings and B) his readers.

No. Murdoch is responsible for this behavior and, worse, the fascist garbage his holdings spew in the U.S.A. Blame the gutting of American education and 30 years of every-man-for-himself brainwashing for Americans' swallowing FOX "News" lies.

The wide open journalistic culture created by the Internet has made sensational British tabs such as Murdoch's News of the World and the Sun much more ravenous for exclusives, now to the point where news people are breaking the law to get scoops.

This is hard for Americans, especially American journalists, to fathom since we have long dispensed with a competitive sensational press and the scoop is almost unknown today. Oddly, we once had more tabs and more yellow journalism than the British.

Keep in mind, Britain has no constitutional free press guarantee...although the European Union had a free press guarantee in its charter. www.hard-truths.blogspot.com

why is this a surprise.  we've known for years that Murdoch has no interest in truth and the integrity of journalism, much less the public interest journalism.  Witness FOX and the way it has demeaned civil public discourse and created a culture of hatred all for a buck.  Unfortunately, many journalists have had to prostitute themselves in service to this hate-filled intellectually-empty gossip masquerading as journalism -- except for Brit Hume, who actually seems to believe the garbage he spews

This is so degrading to us
- mouse
Exercise gives you confidence. Simple.

I'm a 74 year guy who has been doing some form of exercise all my life, running, swimming, hiking, weights, skiing and a lots of tennis. I always feel good because I do at least an hour of exercise every day, it's similar to brushing your teeth, you wouldn't not do it.
While the research in this area is certainly good to have I do believe that a study with us humans, as oppose to mice, might be more beneficial.
